poem:
"Morning Song for the Guitarist"

Giddy, he awakes, sunlit corners embracing,
In his robe, not a shred of rock star trace.
A single waits in his dawn's cradle, facing
The day's first song in a baby's waking face.
This stone-carved idea, born from morning haze,
Yet plays as an anthem old as time's race.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Fontaines DC: ‘We can generate ideas that sound like they’ve been carved in stone for a thousand years’ Carlos O’Connell isn’t merely excited about the release of Fontaines DC’s new single. He’s “giddy for it. I’m giddy,” he emphasises, reclining in his dressing gown in a sunlit corner of his north London home. His attire is far from rock star loucheness: it’s 9am and the guitarist has already been up for hours with his one-year-old". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Fontaines DC: ‘We can generate ideas that sound like they’ve been carved in stone for a thousand years’ Carlos O’Connell isn’t merely excited about the release of Fontaines DC’s new single. He’s “giddy for it. I’m giddy,” he emphasises, reclining in his dressing gown in a sunlit corner of his north London home. His attire is far from rock star loucheness: it’s 9am and the guitarist has already been up for hours with his one-year-old
